sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Handwritten postcard from Harden to Schenker, dated October 19, 1893
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: Harden thanks Schenker for sending an [unknown] article with a lighter tone than some of Schenker’s other work.
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: Harden, Maximilian; Schenker, Heinrich; Naumann, C. G.; Leipzig; Nietzsche

tei:p.tei:hi: Handwritten postcard from Harden to Schenker, dated October 19, 1893

tei:transcription.tei:p: {recto} [preprinted form with handwritten address information] Deutsche Reichspost Postkarte
An Herrn Dr. H. Schenker in Wien III Wohnung Fraungasse 1.
{verso} [printed header with handwritten date inserted] HERAUSGEBER: [–] BERLIN W. 9. 19.X 93 MAXIMILIAN HARDEN [–] DIE ZUKUNFT [–] 27 KÖTHENER STRASSE. [decorated printed rule]
besten Dank für den sehr schönen Artikel, The article in question is uncertain. der auch nicht so „gedunkelt“ war wie mancher Anderen—nichts für Ungut!
C. G. Naumann in Leipzig, Nietzsches Verleger. The reason for this reference is unclear.
Mit herzlichen Grüßen, Immer Ihr [signed:] Harden

tei:p.tei:hi: Handwritten postcard from Harden to Schenker, dated October 19, 1893

tei:translation.tei:p: {recto} [preprinted form with handwritten address information] German Imperial Post Postcard
To Dr. H. Schenker in Vienna III Adress Fraungasse 1.
[postmark:] || Berlin S. W. | a | 46 | 20 10 | 93 | 9-10AM. || [postmark:] || f | Vienna 3/1 | 40 | 21.10.93 | 10-11AM || [postmark:] || Vienna 3/3 | 49 | Delivered | 21.10.93, 1PM. ||
{verso} [printed header with handwritten date inserted] EDITOR: [–] BERLIN W. 9. October 19, 93 MAXIMILIAN HARDEN [–] DIE ZUKUNFT [–] 27 KÖTHENER STRASSE. [decorated printed rule]
Sincere thanks for the very fine article, which is also not so “gloomy” as some others—no offense!
C. G. Naumann in Leipzig, Nietzsche’s publisher.
With cordial greetings, Yours ever, [signed:] Harden
